Override.description:
An override provides alternative sources for a variable, activated via
the `--override` CLI flag.

default.description: Fallback source for this override when the environment has no entry.

envs.description: Map of environment names to value sources for this override.

Source.description:
How to obtain the value for a variable in a given environment.

Exactly one of `literal`, `cmd`, `sh`, `template`, or `skip` must be
specified.

cmd.description: A command to execute; stdout is captured and trimmed.

sh.description: A shell script to execute via `sh -c`; stdout is captured and trimmed.

skip.description: When `true`, the variable is silently omitted from output.

template.description: A minijinja (Jinja2) template string. Reference other variables with `{{ VAR_NAME }}`.

Variable.description: A single environment variable with per-environment sources.

default.description:
Fallback source used when the requested environment has no entry in
`envs`.

description.description: Human-readable description, rendered as a comment in output.

envs.description: Map of environment names to value sources.

overrides.description:
Named overrides that can be activated via `--override` on the CLI.
Each override provides alternative `default`/`envs` sources that
take precedence over the base sources when active.

tags.description:
Tags for conditional inclusion. When `--tag` flags are passed on the
CLI, only variables with at least one matching tag (or no tags) are
included.

description: Top-level envoke configuration, typically loaded from `envoke.yaml`.

variables.description: Map of variable names to their definitions.

title: Config
